title: How does epic poetry differ from prose and drama? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are numerous differences between epic and prose or drama … Few instances : An Epic deals with some heroic theme while a drama presents some theatrical conventions and a prose illustrates universal or personal matter. An Epic has some rhyming end with each sentence to other. But it is only in the verse drama that we find lyric element, generally it is hardly found. In prose it is too unseen. An invocation imparts an epic its perfection. In the matter of drama or prose, here is nothing of invocation. One of the most essential features of an epic is to have the portrait of Gods or Goddesses, except some supernatural or mythical figures a poetry can not be called an epic. In comparison with drama or prose, supernatural elements is not necessary to construct a drama or prose.

The definition of an epic is "a long poem, typically one derived from ancient oral tradition, narrating the deeds and adventures of heroic or legendary figures or the past history of a nation." So yeah, that.
